snippet: Critics accuse the United States Agency for International Development of, among other things, taking on projects with little concern for local priorities.
abstract: Critics accuse United States Agency for International Development of having little impact in Pakistan, despite operating there for over 10 years and distributing billions of dollars in aid; say agency is mismanaged with majority of aid money going to fund administrative costs and that they often adopting projects without prioritizing need and impact.
lead_paragraph: Critics accuse the United States Agency for International Development of, among other things, taking on projects with little concern for local priorities.

headline.main: In Pakistan, U.S. Aid Agency’s Efforts Face Skepticism
headline.print_headline: In Pakistan, U.S. Aid Agency’s Efforts Are Yielding Dubious Results

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Agency for International Development
